titleStmt.title: J. J. McIntosh to J. D. Landram and E. W. Smith
CWG4645

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Paducah Ky Feb 10th 64.
Dr. J D Landram & E W. Smith Esq.
Gents

There were two Judgments rendered by the Graves Circuit at the May term 1863 against Me for for $60.00 each for the offence of keeping a tippling house. They are both repleved and the bonds are now due, and the fines interest and cost will amount to Sum $150.00 $160.00. And under the circumstances it will work a great kindness on me to have to pay the State that amount.

I therefor write to ask of you the favor to see the Governor and try and induce him to remit the fines. I hope you will attend to the matters for me without delay for if Something is not done to release me I will the muney to pay and thereby suffer very Seriously as my family need all the means I am able to command for there daily support
P S Lucein Andersin wrote to the Gov. Sometime last fall about the Matter Sometime last fall.
We know the within petition & say to you that his fine ought not to be remited

To His Excellency
Gov,, Bramlett } J D Landram Senator
E W Smith
BEPG

McCracken Co
Refused
Tho. E. Bramlette
Govr of Ky
